Subjects: proverbs; tongue, destructive power of; translations
_description: A proverbial saying about evil tongues, trans. Latin, ‘Cui mala lingua datur semper que sunt mala fatur’ — one couplet

BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 49.

RylandsLat394.Transcription: Who os hase an euel tongeeuer he spekes þat is wronge
RylandsLat394.Note: Written on one line, as prose.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 99.
